title: option parsing into separate file from main to enable testing with catch
Header guards: KLUST_<file>_H_ vs. SRC_<file>_H_ ?
body:
Do we follow the C++ style guide and use e.g.

``` cpp
#ifndef KLUST_SEQUENCE_H_
```

or the format dictated by the `cpplint` tool?

``` cpp
#ifndef SRC_SEQUENCE_H_
```

title: More testing of KmerCollection
body: Especially for `k = 8` as this is handled as a special case and is not currently tested.

title: Less testing of KmerCollection
body:
There are many redundant tests (lines 60-77). The relevant tests are:
- test that ++ increments correctly.
- test that ++ behaves correctly at iteration termination.
- test that -- decrements correctly.
- test that -- behaves correctly at iteration start.

Moveover, use a minimal testing example - maybe a sequence of length 3 and a kmer size 2.

title: Problems with the linking of klust-test?
body:
For instance `test_seq_entry.cc` includes the source file for `SeqEntry` and does not work when including the header file. It gives "undefined reference `SeqEntry::`...." errors during linking and that is for public member functions.

Is it for some reason necessary to include the source file or is this a problem with the CMake configuration?

title: Introduce the use of C++ mocks for testing
body: Good for lots of things.

title: Use BioIO in klust
body: For instance by cloning BioIO repository when making.

title: Clustering Implementation
body:
I have now created two different naive clustering implementations, each living in a separate branch. We have to decide which implementation we want to move forward with.
#### https://github.com/BIO-DIKU/klust/compare/naive-clust-collection

This implementation looks the most like our UML and simply stores all the results in a collection (currently a vector). 
The problem i see with this implementation is that it does not scale well with a high amount of sequences.
#### https://github.com/BIO-DIKU/klust/compare/naive-clust-immediate

To try to fix the problems of the first solution i have created this solution, which returns an immediate result for each sequence provided, and then when the clustering is done, it is possible to get the summarised clusters with how many sequences they contain (but no references to specific sequences).
This implementation is suitable for the output format UCLUST uses.

---

Please ask if you have any questions. When a decision is made we can open a pull request for the appropriate branch and fix it up and review it properly.

Also. Please join the discussion. Even if you have no strong opinion, i would like to hear that too.

title: Linking with BioIO SeqEntry not working
body:
I can't seem to get `klust` working with BioIO's SeqEntry. I include it with:

``` cpp
#include <BioIO/seq_entry.h>
```

and it almost compiles, but fails with link errors like the following:

```
CMakeFiles/klust.dir/src/fasta_writer.cc.o: In function `FastaWriter::write(SeqEntry const&)':
/home/akh/uni/BIO-DIKU/klust/src/fasta_writer.cc:72: undefined reference to `SeqEntry::seq() const'
```
